channel.title: L4D Series: Overrated and Waste of Development Time
channel.description:
Hire me Valve, I will work 18 hours a day on the only game true fans care about.
The Half-Life series.
Best single player games ever. Best story in a video game ever. In fact, the only story I have ever cared about in any video game.
There is so much to the HL series. I'm saddened to see that they put development time in to something their real fans don't even care about.
HL2: Raising the Bar is the most inspiring book I own. Nothing about the L4D series can compare to that.

item.title: L4D Series: Overrated and Waste of Development Time
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
Katamarikitten… the date format of this forum is day / month / year. This means the post before yours was 19th, January, 2010.

You bumped a 5 month old thread. This is why folks are trying to set fire to you. Enjoy your crispyness with tender joy; we only fry those we love. (right?) And we love new folks.

Anyway. Katamarikitten now understands the format, and the rest of us can stop posting and let this die.

Read full topic

item.title: L4D Series: Overrated and Waste of Development Time
item.dc:creator: KatamariKitten
item.description:
mga:

No, I’m serious L4D is overrated. Little replayability and boring game.

Awwwwww are you mad someone doesn’t wike your wittle game?

You go fuck yourself, cunt fuck.

Someone asked what I consider good with a lot of replayability.

Let’s see…

HL Series:
Best story in gaming by far, good gameplay, able to tackle situations in different ways each time.

CoD MW/MW2:
Good maps, tons of guns and unlocks, tons of game modes. Switch classes during games and completely change your style of play.

League of Legends/Heroes of Newerth:
Dozens of champions in both games, different game every time.

Those are actually the only 3 games I consistently play.

Then we have L4D 1/2:
4 big maps (campaigns), limited weapon selection (L4D2 changed this but still, new weapons got boring fast). For the most part it’s the same every time.

Where is the replayability in that?

Edit again:

Adding Crysis to the list of replayability

Crysis:
Weapon customization is extremely well done. Suit options and open world allow you to play each mission dozens of different ways. I load up the game a couple times a week to play through a few different levels and try out different ways of completing them.

Ugh. Just… No.
Crysis = Replayability? Are you a blind 12-year-old kid?
And you also have hopped on the MW2 band-wagon? I agree it is a DECENT game, but in my opinion, there are better.

I will list a few flaws in your theorem about Modern Welfare 2 :
-Overpowered killstreaks
-Tactical Insertions
-Glitches
-“Classic” playlist alternative
-Spawning system (hurdur)
-Overpowered guns
-Snipers suck (ACOG-scope my grandmothers ass)
-Last stand… 'nuff said
-Model 1887 Akimbo HURR DURRRRRR
-Commando knifing
-Maps unappealing

Heroes of Newerth doesn’t appeal to me. It is quite a DotA-clone.

L4D/2 is fun with friends, and I doubt you have any.

It seems that every good forum has a select group of 12-year-olds like you.
Hopefully they permab& your ass

Read full topic

item.title: L4D Series: Overrated and Waste of Development Time
item.dc:creator: Master_Chef
item.description:
Brother Shrike:

Half-Life wasn’t great for its story, it wasn’t terrible, but it wasn’t overly original. Half-Life was great for how it told its story.

Exactly. Just because you tell a story well, doesn’t mean that the story itself is good.

Read full topic

item.title: L4D Series: Overrated and Waste of Development Time
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
mga:

Hire me Valve, I will work 18 hours a day on the only game true fans care about.

The Half-Life series.

Best single player games ever.
Best story in a video game ever. In fact, the only story I have ever cared about in any video game.

There is so much to the HL series. I’m saddened to see that they put development time in to something their real fans don’t even care about.

HL2: Raising the Bar is the most inspiring book I own. Nothing about the L4D series can compare to that.

I was also mildly disappointed about the lack of EP3 news, but come on, get over it already!

Besides, I only played the L4D2 demo on my crappy computer, and it was still awesome. A bit like TF2 graphics-wise, but still awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: L4D Series: Overrated and Waste of Development Time
item.dc:creator: Soviet
item.description:
Master Chef:

I don’t know why everyone keeps saying this. Its bullshit. The story suck major penis. Just because a game is immersive doesn’t mean its story is good.

Unless “lol gordan go escape da lab and kill teh zombehs” suddenly became a masterful piece of art in storytelling.

Welcome to the world of having too little intelligence to understand nuance. Enjoy your stay and let the thread die

bigfan421:
  1. mga, you’re a an asshole
  2. mga, there are FAR more than four campaigns available for Left 4 Dead and its sequel (if you’re speaking of the 360 versions, then I guess you’re fucked in that dept. dumbass)

    wow a page full of ninja’d

Modern Warfare does not fall into the category of the uncanny valley effect.

item.title: L4D Series: Overrated and Waste of Development Time
item.dc:creator: nietzschesaurus
item.description:
While I don’t agree that L4D is a waste of development time, I find Zombie Master to be a lot more fun, and have more replayability, both made increasingly better because ZM is free. While VALVe made a good game with L4D, the ZM dev team had already beaten them a year prior.
